column4: So... I'm on a PowerPC computer. I do not want to install linux on this computer. I want to boot off of a Linux PPC LiveCD and use the USB Ubuntu Install tool that is available on the LiveCD, but as far as I can tell the PPC CD is only the installer.
Anyone know how I can boot Ubuntu off of a CD on a PPC processor?
Yes, the only PPC iso I could find is install-only, can't actually boot ubuntu off of it.
oic... u could try unetboot to make a bootable USB of the ppc iso
that's what i said u shud do earlier
u can go from ISO->flash drive
I have to be booted into ubuntu to do that
u can do it on windows
or possibly compile it on mac ;)
yeah yeah >.< let me go get xcode...
i max my connection out with HTTP tho, by adding each mirror to a downloader prog
I don't know why you're so slow, then
